comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Sir Frederick Handley Page, CBE, FRAeS (15 November 1885 – 21 April 1962) was an English industrialist who was a pioneer in the aircraft industry. His company Handley Page Limited was best known for its large aircraft such as the Handley Page 0/400 and Halifax bombers and civil aircraft such as the H.P.42, flagship of the Imperial Airways fleet and remarkable at the time for having been involved in no passenger deaths. He is also known for his invention, with Gustav Lachmann, of the leading edge slot to inprove the stall characteristics of aircraft wings. Page was the uncle of the World War II flying ace Geoffrey Page. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_Handley_Page
